page.title: 13RELIGION - LANGRISH CHURCH
page.content: Langrish Church was built in the 1870 by the Nicholsons of Bordean House as a family church.The builders made it in the style of an old Norman church. It has no historical significance. The church is the only community building in Langrish and is a focus for the village.The upkeep of the church is paid by the congregation and they keep it clean.The congregation is between 15 and 20 people which is 5_6% higher than average.A few festivals are held there each year such as the harvest festival,funerals and weddings.The vicar has to come from E.Meon so a local lady runs the Sunday School.The people generally only take interest in the church at major festival seasons.The age range of attendants is widespread with the only gap being the 13-22 age group. Other churches are at Froxfield & Bordean.
